subject: Adapt-It's Output Formats (was: Re: Call of Cthulhu, now in modern HTML)
msgSnippet: It was originally designed to handle USFM-formatted documents, but works amazingly with flat text documents.
messageBody:
It was originally designed to handle USFM-formatted documents, but works amazingly with flat text documents.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "dipartite" <bonusfrogs@...> wrote:
>
>
>
> What sorts of files does Adapt-It output by default?
>
> When copying and pasting from PDF to Markdown I had to go back and remove line breaks that were between pages. If Adapt-It could spit out text (in UTF-8, of course!) with two line breaks between paragraphs, that takes me 99% of the way to something like <https://raw.github.com/adiabatic/qs-literature/gh-pages/call-of-cthulhu/index.markdown>, which is what I feed into Jekyll/Github Pages to turn into a nicely-formatted HTML page.
>
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Timothy" <tim_rice09@> wrote:
> >
> > Thank you. Thank you very much. PDFs are great and all, but resizing is wonderful.
>
